reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Located in the heart of the old town in Saint Malo, the Hotel Cartier is a good place to stay when visiting this area. The hotel has a modern décor with comfortable beds and air conditioned rooms which are relatively spacious in comparison to other hotels in France. Across the road from the hotel is a little bistro called ‘Le Biniou’ which was very reasonably priced and quite tasty! There are an abundance of restaurants around this hotel so finding somewhere to eat isn’t an issue. The only drawback to this hotel is the parking. It was a nightmare trying to find parking outside the gates of the old town. We drove around for over an hour trying to find parking as there are no spaces available for guests in the old town. We dreaded leaving in the morning time as we knew we would find it difficult to park on our return that evening. That aside, the hotel itself is very pleasant and reasonably priced, I would recommend it.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel in a Great Location

reviews.text: I travelled with my mother on a Brittany Ferry 'Stroller' break and chose this hotel because of the good reviews I had seen of it. The hotel certainly lived up to the reviews and was easy to find. Although we arrived at 9:30 having travelled on the overnight ferry we were able to go straight up to our small but very clean and comfortable twin room. The staff were very helpful and spoke excellent English. Breakfast is served from 6:30 so we were able to enjoy that before heading back to the ferry the following day.
reviews.title: Very welcoming hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would definitely stay there again if returning to St Malo.
reviews.title: perfect location if you don't have a car

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am very glad that most other reviews for this hotel are very positive because we could not fault it, providing you accept that a 3 star hotel in an ancient walled city will be very compact. The interior of the hotel appears to have been recently totally rebuilt and is very modern and clean with new furnishings, large en-suite shower room, LCD flat screen TV and tea/coffee making facilities. Yes, the room was small and the bed was firm but it was very comfortable and adequate for two people. The hotel also has a modern lift and air conditioning.
reviews.title: Nice but very small room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The buffet breakfast was excellent and the staff friendly and helpfull.
reviews.title: Best location in st Malo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Me and my girlfriend stayed in the Hotel Cartier for the Easter Weekend 2009. Before even walking through the doors, you notice how it looks like no other hotel in St. Malo: it's V-shaped building makes the corner looking out over one of the main plaza's within the main high-street intersection, step straight out of the hotel into the main centre.
reviews.title: Classy yet cozy. Perfect location. Modern throughout.

reviews.text: Beautifully arranged and decorated entrance hall, all in dark-woods and beige (a theme continued throughout the hotel). Instant check in, the pleasant staff always had a hello. Our room was on the top floor (5th) via the lift. Remote lighting fades up in the hallways etc… (all the nice attention to detail that marks it out as something special). The room was small, but very cozy, like a loft room. I would advise trying to book a corner room though. They are larger and offer stunning 180 views of the city. Particularly room 503, the topmost corner room, with balcony – it’s like something out of Evita, pointing straight at the picturesque Cathedral.
reviews.title: nice hotel...good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Back to our room: the bedside lights were on as we entered, lovely first impression. Dark wood and beige bedstead and spacious wardrobe. Tea making facilities were spartan but welcome. No mini bar or fridge (mainly due to size of the room) but desk with optional wireless internet connection. 20” LCD mounted on the wall with BBC 1 and Channel 4. We were able to angle it towards the bathroom and shower/go to the loo/sink whilst still watching TV! Probably not a feature of every room, but handy in this one!
reviews.title: Wonderful but noisy

reviews.text: Good heating, good windows, good maidservice. Good hotel.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: So the plus points would be:
reviews.title: Very nice hotel, good venue

reviews.text: Having foolishishly decided to pop up to Saint-Malo in the middle of the peak August holiday season, our choices for hotels to accomodate two adults and two chlidren was limited.
reviews.title: OK, but for what we paid, not terrible but not very good just isn't good enough

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In fact, only one came up on any booking website - the Hotel Cartier.
reviews.title: Very conveniantly located, clean but not worth 150 euros a night.

reviews.text: The hotel is well located just inside the walls (Intra Muros) of the old city. This is fortunate as it means that the walk from the public parking lot is shorter than to many of the other hotels in the old city. You could drive to the hotel to drop off your bags, but doing so would require sharing narrow streets with pedestrians a harrowing experience judging from the looks on the faces of drivers of cars not registered in France. There is no onsite parking and parking of any kind is really at a premium anywhere near the old city.
reviews.title: Nice, Pleasant Surprise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The family suite doubles as the disabled suite and, as noted elsewhere, the rooms were bigger than the average European hotel room. Imagine an average European hotel room and add enough space to get past the bed in a wheelchair and maybe turn the chair around.
reviews.title: made our trip as foot passengers very easy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room itself was clean enough and the bed was OK, but the room really needed attention to details.
reviews.title: Small but perfectly formed
